metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1063 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Context relabeling of filesystems is vulnerable to symbolic link attack, allowing a local, unprivileged malicious entity to change the SELinux context of an arbitrary file to a context with few restrictions. This only happens when the relabeling process is done, usually when taking SELinux state from disabled to enable (permissive or enforcing). The issue was found in policycoreutils 2.5-11.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1063` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

newrole - 2.7-1
policycoreutils - 2.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: policycoreutils package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7-1').
